headline: Is Smucker’s Decision To Absorb Coffee Tariffs Reshaping The Investment Case For J. M. Smucker (SJM)?
summary: Earlier this year, J.M. Smucker reversed plans for a third coffee price increase, choosing instead to absorb about US$75 million in tariff-related costs after green coffee was excluded from new U.S. trade measures. By forgoing another price hike despite strong coffee demand and an expected 16% year-over-year revenue increase, the company is prioritizing volume resilience and brand health over short-term margin support. Now we’ll examine how absorbing tariff costs instead of raising coffee...

headline: 3 Unprofitable Stocks with Questionable Fundamentals
summary: Unprofitable companies face headwinds as they struggle to keep operating expenses under control. Some may be investing heavily, but the majority fail to convert spending into sustainable growth.
